title: Bug 21706 - BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
description: Bug 21706 - BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
OB: The BidiUtil class in win32 does not have a private constructor.
EB: Add a private constructor to the BidiUtil class. Since there are no nonstatic methods in this class, it would be a good practice to prevent people from instantiating the class unnecessarily. The size of the class will not increase because the compiler provides a free public constructor by default. You're just making the constructor private instead of public.
SR:
1. Open the BidiUtil class in win32 code.
2. Add a private constructor to the class.
